alert.note: Alert for Custer; Garfield; Holt; Loup; Wheeler (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 9:25PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Loup, Garfield, southeastern Holt, northeastern Custer and Wheeler Counties through 1015 PM CDT... At 924 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Chambers to 8 miles east of Victoria Springs State Recreation Area. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Burwell, Taylor, Sargent, Chambers, Bartlett, Comstock, Ericson, Calamus Reservoir State Recreation Area, Weissert, Westerville, Lillian, Walworth, Virginia Smith Dam, Sunfish Lake, Homestead Knolls Campground, Four Corners, Nunda Shoal Campground and Gables. This includes the following highways... Highway 183 between mile markers 96 and 129. Highway 281 between mile markers 141 and 172. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
